thread.title: Free or Paid? Wi-Fi at the Top 15 International Airports
thread.title_full: Free or Paid? Wi-Fi at the Top 15 International Airports

author: By Benet Wilson
title: Free or Paid? Wi-Fi at the Top 15 International Airports
text:
In a past article, I covered which of the top 24 U.S. airports had free or paid Wi-Fi. Both business and leisure travelers have come to expect having access to free and robust Wi-Fi. Watchdog company Rotten WiFi had users test and evaluate the quality of WiFi in more than 130 airports in 53 countries worldwide. In their report, five European, two American and three Asian airports have made to Top 10 list as fastest WiFi airports.
Below is my list on how the top 15 international airports are handling Wi-Fi access to travelers.
Amsterdam Schiphol Airport
The airport offers free unlimited Wi-Fi access in all its terminals. For those who want to use high-speed Internet to stream music and/or videos, upload pictures or connect to a private VPN network, it offers a paid Premium Wi-Fi service. The cost is $2.14 for 15 minutes, $5.39 for 60 minutes and $10.89 for 24 hours.
Beijing Capital International Airport
Wi-Fi access is free for up to five hours in the terminal; paid Boingo Wi-Fi is also available for travelers.
Dublin Airport
The airport’s Terminal 1 is a free Wi-Fi zone, covering Arrivals, Departures, the Mezzanine, The Street, and all the Departure gates. There is no signup or registration process.
Dubai International Airport
Boingo manages the Wi-Fi, and gives travelers free access for 60 minutes. After that, it costs $5.43 an hour for mobile devices or $8.15 per day for laptop computers.
Frankfurt Airport
Germany’s flagship airport offers travelers free 24-hour access to Wi-Fi using the facility’s more than 300 access points.
Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport
Airport Wi-Fi is only available for local residents.
Hong Kong International Airport
The airport offers free Wi-Fi at most seating and public areas in the passenger terminals, with no registration required.
Incheon International Airport
The airport offers free Wi-Fi in all its terminals.
Istanbul Atatürk Airport
Wi-Fi is free at the lounges of the Arrivals and Departures Terminals. Additional wireless access spots within the terminal are subject to the concerned firms’ pricing policies; prices are not available.
London Heathrow Airport
Travelers get free Wi-Fi in all terminals for four hours. Those who enroll in the Heathrow Rewards loyalty program can get another four hours of free Wi-Fi access. Extra access costs $6.21 for four hours, $12.41 for the day, $108.62 for the month and $201.72 for the year.
Paris-Charles de Gaulle Airport
Travelers get free and unlimited Wi-Fi access in the airport’s terminals. It also offers two levels of paid Wi-Fi access: 20 minutes for $3.19 or $6.49 an hour for Wi-Fi Faster; and $10.89 for 24 hours of Wi-Fi Stronger.
Singapore Changi Airport
The airport offers free Wi-Fi in all terminals.
Suvarnabhumi Airport
Bangkok’s largest airport offers travelers two hours of free Wi-Fi.
Tokyo Haneda Airport
The airport offers free Wi-Fi access in the terminal building. For those needing more secure networks, the airport offers access to four vendors: NTT DOCOMO ; NTT East ; SoftBank Telecom ; and Wire and Wireless .
Zurich Airport
Travelers get 60 minutes of free Wi-Fi access. After that, the cost is $7.29 an hour, $10.46 for four hours and $15.43 for 24 hours.
